Harum Sedap, 5 Masakan Khas Indonesia Ini Dimasak Dalam Bambu
01 Nov 2019, 12:29 by Devi Setya - detikFood


Foto: Pradita Utama

Jakarta - Selain dibungkus dengan daun pisang, masyarakat Indonesia juga mengenal teknik masak menggunakan bambu. Aroma dan rasa masakan jadi lebih harum sedap.Batang bambu yang berongga dan kokoh ternyata banyak dimanfaatkan sebagai wadah untuk mengolah masakan. Di berbagai daerah ada makanan tradisional yang dimasak dalam rongga batang bambu.Selain lebih alami, masakan yang dimasak dengan bambu ini juga memiliki aroma dan rasa yang lebih sedap. Di Sumatera, ada lemang yang umum dimasak menggunakan bambu. Lain lagi di Palu yang mengenal ayam bambu sebagai makanan khas. Di Bali ada bebek timbungan yang juga diolah dalam batang bambu.Bukan hanya makanan berat saja, kue manis pun juga ada yang dimasak menggunakan batang bambu seperti kue putu. Berikut beberapa makanan tradisional yang dimasak dalam batang bambu.(dvs/odi)


Foto: istimewa

1. LemangLemang jadi salah satu makanan kebanggaan masyarakat Minang. Makanan yang terbuat dari beras ketan ini tersedia sepanjang tahun dan permintaan lemang akan melonjak menjelang hari besar. Lemang paling banyak diolah di kawasan Tebing Tinggi, sampai-sampai daerah ini dikenal dengan sebutan Kota Lemang.Untuk membuat lemang dibutuhkan bahan utama beras ketan dan santan kelapa. Dua bahan ini dimasukkan ke dalam bilah bambu yang sudah dialasi daun pisang dan kemudian dibakar hingga matang.Setelah matang, batang bambu dibelah dua agar bisa mengeluarkan lemang. Biasanya lemang disantap dengan tapai, jadilah hidangan ini dikenal dengan sebutan lemang tapai. Aroma bambu tercium tipis-tipis pada sajian lemang.Baca juga : Harum Semerbak Ayam yang Dimasak Dalam Buluh Bambu

(dvs/odi)



Foto: istimewa

2. Ayam BambuSesuai dengan namanya, hidangan berbahan daging ayam ini dimasak di dalam sebilah bambu. Hidangan ayam bambu jadi salah satu masakan khas Palu dan banyak diolah di daerah Kulawi, Sigi. Di Manado disebut ayam di buluh atau ayam dalam bambu.Sebelum dimasukkan ke dalam bambu, ayam lebih dulu dipotong-potong kemudian dilumuri bumbu. Setelah ayam sudah siap barulah dimasukkan ke dalam bambu sambil ditambahkan air.Ayam bambu dimasak perlahan dengan cara membakar bagian luar bambu di atas bara api. Dengan cara ini, bumbu akan meresap sempurna hingga bagian tulang ayam. Ayam bambu paling enak dinikmati hangat dengan nasi putih.

(dvs/odi)



Foto: Devi S. Lestari/detikFood

3. Bebek TimbunganKuliner legendaris khas Bali ini dahulu jadi makanan istimewa keluarga kerajaan. Bebek timbungan diolah dengan bumbu khas Bali yang dikenal dengan sebutan bumbu basa gede.Bebek yang sudah dibersihkan akan dilumuri bumbu lalu dimasukkan ke dalam bambu ukuran besar untuk kemudian dibakar. Proses memasak bebek timbungan ini terbilang lama jadi tak heran kalau tekstur bebek timbungan terasa sangat empuk dan bumbunya pekat.Meski sudah berbumbu kuat, tapi orang Bali biasa menyantapnya dengan tambahan sambal matah. Bebek timbungan memang tidak begitu populer tapi di Bali menu legendaris ini tetap bisa dinikmati di beberapa tempat.

(dvs/odi)



Foto: istimewa

4. Pa'piongMasyarakat Toraja punya makanan khas yang juga diolah di dala bambu, namanya pa'piong. Konon kabarnya pa'piong adalah salah satu makanan untuk keluarga bangsawan Toraja zaman dahulu. Kini resepnya sudah tersebar luas dan bisa dinikmati siapa saja.Hingga kini pa'piong kerap disajikan sebagai makanan dalam tradisi adat dan upacara besar. Untuk membuat pa'piong dibutuhkan bambu ukuran besar. Nantinya bambu ini diisi dengan ikan mas, ayam ataupun daging sapi yang sudah dibumbui.Proses memasak pa'piong tidaklah sebentar karena memerlukan waktu 1-2 jam hingga pa'piong matang sempurna. Proses masaknya juga dibakar perlahan di atas bara api. Pa'piong kerap disajikan sebagai lauk makan nasi.

(dvs/odi)



Foto: istimewa

5. Kue PutuSelain makanan berat, bambu juga dijadikan alat untuk mengolah makanan manis seperti kue putu. Di Jawa, kue ini cukup populer dan dikenal dengan sebutan puthu.Kue yang terbuat dari tepung beras kasar dan kelapa parut ini dimasukkan ke dalam bambu berongga kecil. Kemudian dimasak dengan cara dikukus. Kue putu juga biasa diberi isian gula merah yang akan melumer saat baru matang.Dahulu, penjual kue putu mengolah kue ini dengan kukusan khas yang menghasilkan suara unik. Sayangnya kini penjual kue putu tradisional sulit ditemukan.Baca juga : Saat Ibu-ibu Ternate Sajikan Aneka Makanan dalam Bambu ke Bule

Harum Sedap, 5 Indonesian Special Cuisine Cooked in Bamboo
01 Nov 2019, 12:29 by Devi Setya - detikFood


Photo: Pradita Utama

Jakarta - Besides being wrapped in banana leaves, Indonesian people are also familiar with cooking techniques using bamboo. The aroma and taste of the food becomes more fragrant. Hollow and sturdy bamboo stems are widely used as a container for food processing. In various regions there are traditional foods cooked in bamboo cavities. Besides being more natural, dishes cooked with bamboo also have a more pleasant aroma and taste. In Sumatra, there are lemang which are commonly cooked using bamboo. Another in Palu who knows bamboo chicken as a special food. In Bali there are scales that are also processed in bamboo sticks. Not only heavy food, sweet cakes are also cooked using bamboo sticks like putu cakes. Here are some traditional foods cooked in bamboo sticks. (DVS / Odi)


Photo: special

1. Lemang Lemang became one of the Minang pride food. Foods made from glutinous rice are available throughout the year and the demand for lemang will soar before the big day. Lemang is most processed in the Tebing Tinggi area, to the point that this area is known as Lemang City. To make Lemang, the main ingredients are glutinous rice and coconut milk. These two ingredients are put into bamboo blades that have been covered with banana leaves and then burned until done. After being cooked, the bamboo stems are cut in half so that they can release lemang. Lemang is usually eaten with tapai, so this dish is known as lemang tapai. The smell of bamboo is thinly wafted on the serving of lemang. Also read: Fragrant Fragrant Chicken Cooked in Bamboo Reeds

(dvs / odi)



Photo: special

2. Bamboo Chicken As the name implies, this chicken meat dish is cooked in a bamboo stick. Bamboo chicken dish is one of Palu's special dishes and is widely processed in the Kulawi region, Sigi. In Manado it is called chicken in a reed or chicken in bamboo. Before it is put into bamboo, the chicken is chopped first and then covered with spices. After the chicken is ready, then put it in the bamboo while adding water. The bamboo chicken is cooked slowly by burning the outside of the bamboo on the coals. In this way, seasoning will soak into the chicken bones perfectly. Bamboo chicken is best enjoyed warm with white rice.

(dvs / odi)



Photo: Devi S. Lestari / detikFood

3. Timbungan Duck This legendary Balinese culinary was once a special meal for the royal family. The scales are processed with Balinese spices known as big spices. The cleaned ducks will be smeared with spices and then put into large bamboo to be burned. The cooking process of the scales is quite long so it is not surprising that the scales of the duck scales are very tender and the spices are thick. Scales duck is not so popular but in Bali this legendary menu can still be enjoyed in several places.

(dvs / odi)



Photo: special

4. Pa'piongToraja people have a special food that is also processed in bamboo, it's called pa'piong. It is said that pa'piong is one of the foods for the ancient Toraja aristocratic family. Now the recipe is wide spread and can be enjoyed by anyone. Until now, paipiong is often served as food in traditional traditions and ceremonies. To make pa'piong, a large size bamboo is needed. Later this bamboo is filled with goldfish, chicken or beef that has been seasoned. The cooking process of the pancake is not short because it takes 1-2 hours until the pancake is perfectly cooked. The cooking process is also slowly burned on embers. Pa'piong is often served as a side dish to eat rice.

(dvs / odi)



Photo: special

5. Putu Cake In addition to heavy food, bamboo is also used as a tool for processing sweet foods such as Putu Cake. In Java, this cake is quite popular and is known as puthu. Cakes made from coarse rice flour and grated coconut are put into small hollow bamboo. Then cooked by steaming. Putu cake is also usually given a filling of brown sugar that will melt when it is just ripe. In the past, Putu cake sellers process this cake with distinctive steam which produces a unique sound. Unfortunately, now traditional putu cake sellers are hard to find. Read also: When Ternate Women Serve Various Foods in Bamboo to Caucasians
